data.title: Yes, it is in a basement!  Awesome!
data.text: So I live in Boston and had a deja vu walking down the stairs, like going to the bull and finch ( the original cheers).  They had a good selection of beers and Guinness on tap so I was happy.  Then I saw some of the food coming out....wow!  The most delicious comfort foods and bar food you could want.  They have this cheesy french fry thing that is awesome and the rest of the selection looked great too.  Loved the old bar with brass foot rail, and have pool tables, too.  Great place and friendly staff.  Would definitely go again.

data.title: Excellent Pizza and great service
data.text:
There are only a couple of restaurants open in downtown Peoria on a Sunday evening.  Our hotel recommend Richards and it was great.

You head down a flight of stairs into a "hip" basement bar and dining area.  There open until 3AM(?) every night and I imagine it gets a really good bar crowd.  On Sunday, it was just us and a handful of others (some we recognized from out hotel).

We ordered a pizza and it was cooked perfectly.  Thin crust, crispy and piping hot.  A couple of glasses of wine and we were very happy.

data.title: First time!
data.text: I always wanted to try Richards.  The location is pretty cool and I was not prepared for how big it turned out to be.  Great bar scene and good pizza!

data.title: Good food, cool place
data.text: Richard's on Main is an underground restaurant, literally. Food was good, beer selection was good and seasonal, and the atmosphere was cool. Service was great also. Good place to hang with friends or coworkers.

data.title: Good food
data.text: I had the rueben sandwich with fries. It was good but nothing amazing. It was a little pricey. Fries were great sandwich was eh... ok

data.title: Simple, but delicious
data.text:
Generally, I tend to avoid pubs and bars for dinner but downtown Peoria seems to lack proper restaurants so I tried out Richard's despite my pub reservations.

+ Service was fantastic. The waitress was very attentive and polite despite being pretty busy with other tables. A huge contrast to a larger staffed chain restaurant nearby that I had dinner at the pervious night.

+ Food is relatively simple. Nothing too extravagant or daring, but very well prepared and delicious. Dinner options seem to be limited to grilled fish, grilled chicken, or steak, with sautéed onions, mushrooms and fries. As I said, very simple, but it was really good and I enjoyed what I ordered.

+ The atmosphere is intimate, as the restaurant/pub is in a basement right off the sidewalk. Take a date or your SO for a nice night. Leave the kids at home though.

On the whole, I'm just really surprised by this place. Despite my desire to explore the rest of Peoria, I might have to return to Richard's instead.

data.title: Food is better than the pizza
data.text:
Was in the Greater Peoria Metropolitan Area for several days and ended up at this place twice.  The first time my fellow diner and I both had salads, he had chicken on his, I had salmon.  Both were good, proteins were well-prepared and we had no complaints.

Back for lunch a couple of days later and we split a pizza.  Nothing exemplary about it, we generally found it boring and didn't bring the leftovers home.

data.title: Good sevice
data.text: Good service is about the only good thing here. A cold and bleak dining room with bright lights and white walls and no welcoming feel at all. The food was greasy and bland. Warm salads...but the beer was cold! Go to drink, not eat.

data.title: Always really good
data.text: I stop in frequently before Rivermens hockey games and have never been disappointed with what I pick or what anyone else I'm with gets. Appetizers are huge and the mushrooms and onion rings are fresh breaded there and beyond yummy. There is nothing on the menu to be afraid of. The steaks are always great. The service has always been on point. Horseshoes and rabbit food are killer too.

data.title: Food an After Thought at This Nightspot
data.text: Go to drink not to eat. Arrive in town late & first thing we found walking from hotel. A historic place and plenty of liquor, but that's where it ends. Food overpriced and ordinary; bland in my case. I could best describe it as a Salmon Wrap by McDonald's Fish Sandwich standards at a premium price. Even the McD's isn't as dry.   Steak sandwich chewy fat & grizzly. Waitress did her best, but the real focus is on the young drinking crowd in this basement bar/grill, aka Cheers.

data.title: Good food - Great Steak
data.text: The steak sandwich is amazing. Good food and very good french fries, nice assortment of beers to choose from. The basement eating isn't my thing and that is why the 4 stars instead of 5.

data.title: Peoria version of Cheers
data.text: Had a quick lunch here and really enjoyed the atmosphere, service and selection. Normal pub food, but wider selection than normal and the chicken wrap on a tomato wrap was very good.

data.title: "Cheers" Like Atmosphere
data.text: Not to repeat what a lot of other people said, but Richard's did feel a lot like the TV show Cheers.  A lot of that is from the entrance from the street, with a stairway leading to a lower level.  The food is very much pub fare and they had a decent number of microbrews on tap.  We went on New Year's Eve and the staff was very accommodating.  We did have a reservation since we had 8 people, but we were surprised that we may not have needed one.  Best safe than sorry.  The prices were fair and the food was good.  We couldn't have asked for anything better on a busy New Years Eve.

data.title: 1/9/16 lunch
data.text:
My husband and I had lunch this Saturday for the first time at Richard's. The decor was nice and comfortable. The staff was awesome and attended to all our needs.

The food was great and reminded me of Benjamin's in Galena Illinois. Sadly that place closed but this will be my new favorite place as long as it stays open. I had the BLT with fries and it was delicious. The way food should be instead of the fast food style stuff we get sometimes.

The food was reasonable price wise for the good sized portions. I will be back very soon to try the chilli and more. My type of comfort food.

data.title: Good value. Good food and good service.
data.text: I'm rating this as a pub that serves food.  I certainly wouldn't call it a steakhouse nor suggest that it's anything other than casual. Our party of 4, including 1 child, went to Richard's for a 7pm dinner on a Monday.  The food and service was good.  Food came out pretty quickly. The lights were low so I can't say anything about cleanliness. Liked the entrance and the brick walls inside.

data.title: Cheers!!
data.text: Makes me this of Cheers!! I never would have guessed that this restaurant below the street would be so great!! Love the atmosphere and the food. Have been here a few times and will go back again.

data.title: Average Steak house with a few local craft beer selections
data.text: Average steak house with a few craft beer selections. The staff was friendly. The facility was not as clean as most steak houses in the area but the price was cheaper than most.

data.title: Cool vibe but that's about it
data.text: Really cool how it's underground. It's a basement feeling and is right under the Apollo theater but the food was mediocre. All of us got steak sandwiches which from the advertisement said was their specialty but wasn't anything special. One visit was enough for me.

data.title: Great food and service, convenient location downtown.
data.text: Richards is located underground with access from main street across from the courthouse.  Good food and fast service.  A great alternative to the food carts at lunch time.  They are also open late, which is nice because there are limited choices in the area for good hot food. If you find yourself out in the downtown area definately stop in for a bite.  They have a good range of food choices from a giant grilled cheese on a club to grilled chicken to pizza.

data.title: Great underground restaurant and bar!
data.text: Great bar and restaurant in downtown. You enter on the sidewalk and go down stairs into the bar. The food is really good and has a great variety at reasonable prices. Good selection of tap and bottle beers. They serve food until 3:30 am and alcohol until 4:00 am. The staff was great and service was great. Go check this place out!
